intro: Picridium tingitanum var. subintegra, commonly known as the Moroccan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a follicle containing seeds with a tuft of silky hairs. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in Mediterranean climates.
